input_text:
Job Title: Senior Product Manager, Developer Experience

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
This position is open to candidates based in NYC.

About Pinecone

Pinecone is on a mission to build the search and database technology to power AI applications for the next decade and beyond. Our fully managed vector database makes it easy to add vector search to AI applications. Since creating the “vector database” category, demand has grown incredibly fast and it shows in our user base. We are a distributed team with clusters in New York, San Francisco, Tel-Aviv, and Manchester.

About The Role

We're looking for a passionate Product Manager, Developer Experience, to join our growing team and play a key role in shaping the future of our industry-leading vector database platform.

In This Role, You Will

Conceive and execute on a product vision and strategy for our developer API including SDKs and integrations with 3rd party vendors and frameworksDesign intuitive and developer-friendly API interfaces, SDKs, and documentation experiences.Define and execute a roadmap for the SDK/API engineering team by aligning with Pinecone’s strategic objectives and developer needs.Conduct user research by engaging directly with developers through interviews, surveys, forum participation, and more to understand their pain points and requirementsAnalyze API usage data and feedback to measure product success and uncover new opportunitiesAdvocate for the developer throughout the product lifecycle, ensuring their voice is heard in all product decisions.Craft compelling messaging and content that resonates with the developer audience.Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to create developer-focused initiatives, events, and programs.Stay up-to-date on the latest trends and innovations in developer tools and industry best practices.

Requirements

2+ years of professional software engineering experience or bachelor's degree in computer science2+ years of product management experienceUnderstanding of developer needs and familiarity with API’s/SDK’s, and developer tools.Excellent communication skills to convey research findings and product recommendations to non-technical peers and leaders.Experience gathering feedback, input and data from users and running beta testsProficiency in SQL and experience analyzing, interpreting, and leveraging data to make strategic, business decisions. You enjoy empirical, data-driven approaches to deployment

Bonus Points

Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, and Azure)Familiarity with vector databases and generative AI

Perks & Benefits

Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, vision, and mental health resources401(k) PlanEquity awardFlexible time offPaid parental leaveAnnual Company RetreatWFH Equipment Stipend

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB) are the cornerstone of everything we do at Pinecone. Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications in a job description. Our top priority is finding the best candidate for the job and if you are interested in the position, we would encourage you to apply, even if you don’t believe you meet every one of the qualifications listed in this posting. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
